website_summaries.verdict: Fun portable grill that runs from gas and distributes heat evenly across grill.
pros: Efficient design that makes this travel grill easy to carry anywhere
Runs from portable propane cylinders, which are easy to find in most hardware stores
Unlike most tiny grills, the heat will be distributed evenly across the entire cooking surface
cons: It's far more expensive than portable grills using charcoal

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a nice grill
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice grill, 2 stars is for the quality control. Lines were leaking gas at the regulator. Was fairly easy to disassemble and tighten, but I shouldn't have to do this to a quality product right out of the box. Glad I tested it out at home before I was in the woods trying to cook dinner. I'll come back and improve my review if it's deserved.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Paint Peeled On First Firing
customer_reviews.text: Received it today. Thought I’d season it to give it the maximum opportunity to perform and earn five stars. Fired it up and paint starting chipping off at the seam of the upper clamshell cover. I mean really, that fast? Where’s the quality control? Ever hear of high heat paint? This s a really poor start. I’m starting to hear Weber advertisements in my head.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey C

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! It's a little heavy but not too bad. It lights up first time. It has a fully adjustable temperature range which is great. Easy to clean. I also bought the table and it works wonderful. It's price is on the high side but it's the best BBQr I've had.
customer_reviews.author: frequentshopper210

customer_reviews.title: Lots of heat, lots of room
customer_reviews.text: Used it 4 times now with no flaring issues, I also clean it each time to prevent grease buildup. Fairly easy to clean, it's a bit tricky getting under the burner tube. It's bit heavy and has short legs so setting it up on the ground would be difficult for anyone with back issues. Follow cleaning instructions, I used an oven cleaner and I think it stripped the no stick finish :(
customer_reviews.author: Ann Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. I did a lot of research on portable gas grills and wanted the smallest possible, but finally decided for this one because of the size and the brand. It is not super light but it is very sturdy, retains the heat very well and makes the grilling experience really nice. Fits perfectly between the seats in my sedan. I also bought the carrying bag and that helps a lot when dragging it around parks. Takes 2 minutes to set up, one 1lb propane cylinder burns for about 2-2.5hr on mid-hight and 3.5 hrs on medium-low.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Vassilev

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: A regular grill just wasn’t working for us. The wind always caught a hold of it and destroyed it. My husband suggested a portable grill we can just keep in our shed. We bought the connector to attach a bigger propane tank and it has worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Eadlr11

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill is the best. A buddy brought his on a camping trip, and I had to get my own. It is bit enough to handle cooking decent amounts of food, but still small enough to be easily hauled around. The design is fantastic, and it appears to be quite durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good item for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th one I have had, we use them all them time, and all of my family has one, we love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: The best portable grill on the market. Eclipses the weberQ by far on portability. I receive non stop compliments and references to it looking like a spaceship.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: After having a larger camp chef grill it got to be a pain hauling it around and setting it up because of the size and weight. We sold that and purchased this grill after much searching. This grill has fit our needs and when we have group BBQs many have commented on it.
customer_reviews.author: clmichel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great travel grill. Heats quickly and evenly. Good quality construction and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Toyvo

customer_reviews.title: Napoleon grill
customer_reviews.text: This is for the Napoleon TQ2225PO. This was bigger than I thought it was going to be. Have only used it a few times so as it gets used will update. In a good wind it worked pretty good hold the heat. I had to put it down on low to cook my burgers so they didn't burn. Cook chicken kebabs on med low and was perfect. Pictures are on the Homer spit, Alaska and the wind is blowing most of the time and it was in high 50s deg f. They cover for this would not ship to Alaska but the grill would, go figure that one out. I think it will work well with are RV.
customer_reviews.author: AKmoose

customer_reviews.title: Faulty ignition
customer_reviews.text: Unit has functioned adequately but the ignition device quit functioning almost immediately. I will be contacting the company for a solution.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT A DUCHEMIN

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend this much $ on a portable grill, but I am really glad I did! It is fantastic! It heats up quick, has a nice big grilling/surface area and is really easy to clean up. Overall, this grill is very solid and excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: SandMann

customer_reviews.title: Large and in charge yet super stylish as well!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! Large and in charge yet super stylish as well. We were able to easily cook 8-10 patties on this grill/hot dogs for the kids following. Easy clean up, we just wrapped foil around the drain cup and tossed it out afterwards. Very cool, Big but portable and light enough to tote with us in our boat! I purchased the carrying bag too which is very sturdy and I am happy with that as well. A+ -Happy Customer! :)
customer_reviews.author: MikaSJ

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It is light but actually not that ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is light but actually not that small. Enough to cook burgers for 6-8 people. I usually use it only for 2-4 people, but even doing more is OK. The burner is awesome, easy to regulate. Heats really nicely but does not burn things. The grill is good quality. I totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ddb

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for grilling at work, and now use it home. It heats up fast, a breeze to clean, and a great alternative to grilling if you want to just do a couple of burgers or steaks ( although the grill would hold 6 - 8 burgers and four or five steaks easily!)
customer_reviews.author: Mike Evans

customer_reviews.title: "Orange" you happy?  Yes.
customer_reviews.text: Great item for use with our camping trailer. Nice grill surface size. Heated evenly and well. Easy to light. Nice drip pan location. Loved the orange.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: smart look.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made!! Strong construction, smart look...all makes sense. But for e it was just to heavy. I camp alone and it is difficult for me to manage. Still searching for my perfect Arch.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gardner Riel

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed ... Returned!
customer_reviews.text: Had high expectations coming from Napoleon. Extremely uneven cooking with VERY little heat, need to move the food constantly to get even cooking results. Also, because there is no rim; food constantly falls off. While camping this is a big problem as the feet/legs cannot be adjusted. Too bad as I really wanted to like this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Elaine L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Profile - Great Quality Grill
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. The grates are heavy cast iron. I like that you can stand it in the corner out of the way--one of the benefits of the design. Orange is fantastic! I did purchase the Q Carry Bag, which opens nicely to fit it in, but if I want to store the grill on my balcony, I have to put a plastic bag over it since the carry bag is open at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great grill!
customer_reviews.text: I love grilling, and this grill is fantastic! The cooking is even and the cast iron grill is easy to clean. It isn't heavy and easy to maneuver. Control of the flame is also easy too, though a temperature gauge would be a nice additive. The only real negative is the use of propane canisters instead of a big propane tank like other grills.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Berman

customer_reviews.title: My second Napolen BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I use My BBQ all the time it cooks like no other BBQ, the grill size is great. I bought this one for a second to take camping.
customer_reviews.author: Davis House

customer_reviews.title: Great price, super fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great price, super fast delivery, excellent product...sets up in a flash, heats up quick and evenly, cooks great and is ez to clean...I love the portability - excellent for taking with us on our camping trips...
customer_reviews.author: derF

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill! We use it everywhere. Camping,home, tailgating. Even kayak camping.
customer_reviews.author: Bert and Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for cooking.
customer_reviews.text: We had an O-Grill, which is identical, but I accidentally destroys it by my own negligence. I really like this grill and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for my Motorhome
customer_reviews.text: I just moved into my Motorhome and needed a grill. I travel alone so a small grill is what I wanted. I tried a Smoky Joe but dealing with the ash was a mess on the road so I bought a Coleman gas grill which was nice but too heavy to lift in and out of the Motorhome as I traveled. Then I got a Napoleon Travel Q. It's perfect. It's light weight, sets up in seconds, heats uniformly, and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Carol B

customer_reviews.title: awesome portable bbq
customer_reviews.text: Grill is awesome.li have a friend that has had one for 3 years.it lights every time and cooks evenly.the cast iron grate is easy to clean and I have done 4 dinners on one small bottle of propane so far...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Allard

customer_reviews.title: Great tailgater.
customer_reviews.text: Great grill for tailgating. Easy to set up (less than a minute) and cooks the basics very easily. Compact size and travel bag (sold separately) make it easy for traveling. Cleaning it is the somewhat difficult/annoying part.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: adaptable for propane tank
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grill for at least 5 years-it was known as the o-grill then. Mine looks the same as the Napoleon grill. In the question area it was said you have to use propane bottles-not so. I have always used a propane tank. I used an adapter we had for our RV.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Lea

customer_reviews.title: No grill for pancakes just barbecuing
customer_reviews.text: I had mine out for four years not too heavy well-made and compact cooks good I like it I wish it had a grill for cooking Bacon and pancakes or eggs on it
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: ... patio and this grill and its stand work just fine in the space
customer_reviews.text: My townhouse has a very small patio and this grill and its stand work just fine in the space. You can hook it up to a large propane tank (you'd have to purchase the connectors separately) but I chose not to take up the room. Sometimes it is a guessing game when my little propane bottle is going to run out so I always keep an extra! I also wanted a cover and found that if you buy a smoker cover, it works really well. Circular like the grill and its stand and the length is also right with the elastic at the bottom. Couldn't live without this grill. Bon appetit!
customer_reviews.author: Not Julia Child

customer_reviews.title: excellent heat distribution and and top shelf quality
customer_reviews.text: After years of using 'disposable' $25 portable propane bbqs, I decided to be an adult and spend some money on something that would last. I've had this Travel Q for 6 years and would absolutely buy another. I own a Weber Performer Charcoal, a Weber Genesis Gas and Weber Smokey Mountain, and could be considered a Weber fanboy. I've used the Weber Q series and Napoleon side by side, and both me and the Weber owners would take the Napoleon hands down. Decent heat for a portable, excellent heat distribution and and top shelf quality. Plenty of looky-lous in parks, etc. Do yourself a favour and get the extremely well made cover.
customer_reviews.author: Buford

customer_reviews.title: I've owned one for 3 years now and love it. I works perfectly every time
customer_reviews.text: I've owned one for 3 years now and love it. I works perfectly every time. The push button igniter works great and always fires right up. It gives off lots of heat to bbq steak, ribs, chicken, bake potatoes and just about whatever else you decide to throw on it. You either screw on a disposable propane cylinder and or purchase an adapter hose that can connect to a refillable propane tank. It's only downside if you will is that it is heavy. I HIGHLY recommend also buying the matching carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very uneven heat
customer_reviews.text: Very uneven heating spots. Once you learn where the hot spots are, it cooks well. Trouble is the hots spots are not that big. Can't imagine why a designer would put large holes in a good cast iron plate.........that's where the cooling, uneven heat comes from.
customer_reviews.author: Don

product_meta.title: Napoleon TravelQ TQ2225PO Portable Gas Grill, 225 sq.in, Orange
product_meta.description: With a TravelQ 2225 Portable Propane Gas Grill by Napoleon, you can take quality grilling with you anywhere you go. This portable grill is perfect for a tailgate party, and sets up in seconds! The TravelQ is also great for those who live a compact lifestyle. With an optional stand, you can grill on the go, or tuck the TravelQ away when it's not needed. Generous 225 square inches of grilling area with porcelain coated cast iron cooking grids are durable and distribute the heat evenly for great searing. You'll know it's a Napoleon with the iconic WAVE cooking grids for those distinctive sear marks. Napoleon's TravelQ is made from stamped steel for durability. The stainless steel tube burner resists rust while directing the heat throughout the grill. At home or on the road, the TravelQ by Napoleon is the perfect portable grill. The ergonomic clamshell design makes it easy to take the TravelQ everywhere.
feature_bullets: The TravelQ has a single stainless steel circular tube burner, 10,500 BTU's, and 225 square inches of total grilling area capable of grilling up to 14 hamburgers at once
Napoleon’s iconic cast iron cooking grids provide even heat, prevent food from falling through, and create beautifully distinctive sear marks
Perfect for camping, tailgating, parties, and small outdoor living spaces
Whether you are travelling, tailgating, or barbecueing in the backyard, the windproof design prevents the weather from hindering the preparation of your next meal
Folding legs make it easy to set up or store the TravelQ in seconds
Battery free Piezo ignition provides easy start up each time
Easy on the wrists, the ergonomic handle makes taking this portable grill with you effortless
The ergonomic clamshell design makes it easy to pack into small spaces for travel and transport

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars173 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
